intro: Erysimum adscendens, commonly known as the wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hair, aiding in water retention. Erysimum adscendens is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
